answers.answer: Have you been tested for chlamydia?  Chlamydia is not usually treated with Cipro.  If that is what it is, then no wonder you are still having symptoms.How long are you giving the medication to work?  Sometimes it takes more than a week to get relief when taking antibiotics.  Give it about 10 days after taking your meds and keep following up with the OB/GYN.

question: Okay, so I am having a major problem.  About 10 days ago, I started to have major pain when urinating.  Soon after that I had a rash develop on my perinium and anus develop.  I starting taking Bactrim thinking that if I had an UTI it would wipe it out.  The Bactrim was not working out so I went to the dr.  She perscribed me Cipro, and some Nystatin Triamcinolone cream for the rash.  Well I still was not getting relief so I went to another dr who perscribed me Cipro in a higher dose and pain medication.  That still was not working so I went to the ER.  They tested me for diabetes, they did an catscan on my kidneys and everything came back negative.  They did however say that I had Glucose and protein in my urine.  Well, I went to an OB/GYN the next day who said that I had herpes and still had a UTI.  She perscribed me valtrex and Macrobid.    I am having moderate pain in my hip, my leg, and one side of my lower stomach.  This is not going away.  Also, I am finding it hard to urinate now as well and it is still burning.  Anyone know whats going on?  I need help.
title: Major Problem
